title: Five Steps for Solving the Rare-Earth Metals Shortage - BCG
summary: Governments, businesses, and consumers must take action to avoid an impending supply and demand imbalance for rare earth minerals or it will become a bottleneck, significantly limiting the world’s chances to meet its carbon emissions goals. Governments will have to play the most prominent role by creating enabling conditions to foster the development of new mines, targeting investments directly toward upstream rare-earth mining, improving transparency in the rare-earth mining sector to catalyze commercial opportunities, forging regional and private partnerships to share the effort and the risk, and developing recycling programs for rare-earth elements. The private sector will also have to show leadership for the global market to develop in a coherent fashion.

title: Food technology trends 2023 - FoodManufacture.co.uk
summary: This article highlights 5 technology trends impacting food and beverage production: AI use in food and drink manufacturing, the use of electronic noses (eNoses), the development of cultivated fish and meat products, vertical farms run on renewable energy, and regulatory changes surrounding gene editing in the EU. AI is used to develop new products, eNoses detect odorless chemicals for quality control and freshness evaluations, cultivated fish and meat products are grown in bioreactors without killing any animals, vertical farms are exploring the possibility of being run solely on renewable energy, and gene editing technology is being used to develop healthier and more sustainable crops. The proposed EU legislation would make it easier for products developed using new genomic techniques (NGT) to reach the market.

title: India considering PLI scheme for chemicals, petrochemical sector: Nirmala Sitharaman - The Economic Times
summary: The Indian government is considering a Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme for the chemicals and petrochemical sector, with a goal of becoming energy independent by 2047 and achieving net zero by 2070. The PLI scheme aims to boost local manufacturing of advanced chemistry cell (ACC) batteries, which are key components in electric vehicles and renewable energy storage. The government has also re-bid 20 GWh of ACC manufacturing capacity under the PLI scheme.
